item.title: Procedure
item.description: OCR‎ > ‎ What's a good OCR? A good OCR has high accuracy. It may be better to keep the OCR result as separate pages, and have them associated with the original images. This can help in the following ways: helps proofreading, as described here. it may be helpful to include with each entry a link to the page in the book, so that even if the reader/user suspects OCR errors, they can click on the link and see the original page.
